title: Jennifer Garner won't allow daughter Violet, 13, to join Instagram
text:
Jennifer Garner's daughter Violet is a teenager now, so naturally she must be pretty interested in joining Instagram.

But as far as creating an account for the 13-year-old goes, Jennifer is putting her foot down.

The actress, 41, revealed on Next Question With Katie Couric she won't allow her daughter to officially join the app because she doesn't believe it's a particularly healthy place for girls her age.

Off-limits! Jennifer Garner has revealed she won't allow her daughter Violet, 13, to join Instagram because she doesn't think it's a positive place for girls her age

'I just say, when you can show me studies that say that teenage girls are happier using Instagram than not, then we can have the conversation,' she explained on Katie's podcast.

'But everything you look at, I don't see anything positive for you out there,' Jennifer explained.

She has allowed Violet access to her own account as an alternative to getting their own.

'You can look at mine when you want to, we can go over it together, but I just don't see it,' she added.

Doting mom: In addition to Violet, Garner and her ex-husband Ben Affleck share Samuel and Seraphina together

Multiple studies have been conducted in an attempt to find a link between social media use and mental health.

A recent study conducted at John Hopkins University says that teenagers who spend more than three hours a day on social media are at a higher risk to experience anxiety, depression, and loneliness.

She may be onto something: Multiple studies have been conducted to find the link between social media usage and mental health

University College London experts also found social media may impact teen mental health, as girls are more vulnerable to be cyberbullied.

Jennifer is currently raising her three children with ex-husband Ben Affleck.

In addition to Violet, the exes share daughter Seraphina, 10, and son Samuel, seven.
